identificationModule.briefTitle: Immunoblot, Chemiluminescence and ImmunoCap Allergen Specific IgE Evaluation of in Allergic Rhinitis Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Immunoblot and Chemiluminescence Assays Versus ImmunoCap: Evaluation of Allergen Specific IgE in Egyptian House Dust Mites Allergic Rhinitis Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In the present study the investigators assay house dust mites (HDMs) IgE in sera of allergic rhinitis patients (AR) using immunoblotting, chemiluminescence, and ImmunoCAP assays to compare between the accuracy of both immunoblotting and chemiluminescence assays, and ImmunoCAP as gold standard.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: All allergic rhinitits patients who were monosensitized to mixed HDMs, identified by SPT, will be subjected to complete history taking and assessment of the inclusion and exclusion criteria, performance of skin prick test and measurement of total serum IgE, measurement of specific IgE by Chemiluminescence Immunoassa, immunoblot assay and ImmunoCAP™ Phadiatop™. The patients will be followed-up for 6 months.

armGroups.label: Allergic Rhinitis Patients
armGroups.description: House dust mites (HDMs) IgE in sera of allergic rhinitis patients (AR) who were monosensitized to mixed HDMs, identified by SPT, is assayed using immunoblotting, chemiluminescence, and ImmunoCAP assays to compare between the accuracy of both immunoblotting and chemiluminescence assays, and ImmunoCAP as gold standard
interventionNames: Diagnostic Test: Sensitization to House dust mites

interventions.name: Sensitization to House dust mites
interventions.description: The SPT is performed at the time of diagnosis and after six-months follow-up period. Serum specific IgE is measured by immunoblotting, chemiluminescence, and ImmunoCAP assays

primaryOutcomes.description: Improvement of symptoms and signs of allergy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months from diagnosis to end of Follow-up period

primaryOutcomes.description: Improvement of symptoms and signs of allergy
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 months from diagnosis to end of Follow-up period

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

1. Patient consent.
2. Patient with (18-40) years age known to be allergic rhinitis.
3. Patient with IgE mediated allergic rhinitis (positive total IgE).
4. Patient with positive skin prick testing and monosensitized to HDM

Exclusion Criteria:

1. Patient refusal
2. Patients taking oral corticosteroid.
3. Patients taking anti-IgE injections.
4. Patients taking intranasal corticosteroid.
5. Patient with non- IgE mediated allergic rhinitis.
6. Patients with chronic diseases.
